data.title: Kyrgyzstan (Kyrgyz Republic)
data.text:

Khan of Kyrgyz (title in external relations: Uluu Manap [Great Lord])1842 - 1854 Ormon Khan (b. 1792  d. 1854)

Ruler of Alay Kyrgyz (title: Datka) 1865 - Aug 1876 Kurmanjan (f) (b. 1811  d. 1907) (originally under Kokand, from Feb 1876 in opposition to Russian rule)

Chairman of Belovodsk People's Council 7 Dec 1918 - 26 Dec 1918 Pavel Blagodarenko (in rebellion)(d. af.1926) PLSR

(acting to 13 Oct 2021)

Territorial Disputes: Disputes in the Isfara Valley continue to delay completion of border delimitation with Tajikistan; delimitation of approximately 15% or 200 km of border with Kyrgyzstan has been hampered by serious disputes over enclaves and other areas. Formerly there were several enclaves along the Kyrgzystan-Uzbekistan border: one Kyrgyz enclave in Uzbekistan (Barak), and four Uzbek enclaves within Kyrgyzstan (Sokh, Shohimardon, Jani-Ayil/Jhangail and Chong-Kara/Qalacha), in accordance with the terms of a bilateral agreement, Barak was absorbed by Uzbekistan, with Kyrgyzstan receiving an equivalent parcel of Uzbekistan's Andijon province in exchange on 15 Apr 2024, in accordance with May 2023 approval of demarcations by the Nov 2022 Kyrgyzstan and Uzbekistan ratification of the final treaty delimiting their border.

Party abbreviations:ANR = Ar-Namys/Dostoinstvo (Dignity, conservative, Russophile, est.1999); AS = Akshumkar/Ak Shumkar (White Falcon Party, liberal conservative, est.2005); ATM = Ata-Meken Sotsialisttik Partiyası/Sotsialisticheskaya Partiya Ata-Meken (Ata-Meken Socialist Party, social democratic, liberal, est.1999); KSP = Kırgızstan Sotsial-demokratiyalık Partiyası/Sotsial-demokraticheskaya Partiya Kyrgyzstana (Social Democratic Party of Kyrgyzstan, center-left, social democratic, est.1 Oct 1993); MBM = Mamlekettik Birimdik jana Mekençildik sayasiy partiyası "Bir Bol" (State Unity and Patriotic Political Party "Bir Bol", liberalism, Russophile, est.28 Jun 2010); Mek = Mekenchil (Patriotic Party, nationalist, est.2010); RP = Respublika (Republic, populist, conservative, merged with Ata Zhurt as Respublika-Ata Zhurt 20 Oct 2014-May 2020, est.Jun 2010); SPK= Sayasiy Partiyası"Kırgızstan" (Political Party "Kyrgzstan", centrist, Pro-Zheenbekov, est.May 2015);- Former parties: AZ = Ak Zhol/Yarkiy Put' (Bright Path, pro-presidential, 15 Oct 2007-2010); KEK = Kırgızstan Eldik Kıymılı/Narodnoye Dvizheniye Kyrgyzstana (People's Movement of Kyrgyzstan, anti-Akayev opposition alliance, 22 Sep 2004-2010?); PLSR = Partiya Levykh Sotsialistov-Revolyutsionerov (Party of Left Socialist-Revolutionaries, democratic socialist, 19171923, split from PSR, allied with RSDRP-B/RKP)

Kirghiz Soviet Socialist Republic

30 Apr 1929 - 5 Dec 1936 Unapproved Draft Flag

23 Mar 1937 - 1940

1940 - 22 Dec 1952

22 Dec 1952 - 3 Mar 1992

Capital: Frunze

(Pishpek 1924-1926) Hear SSR Anthem

"Kyrgyz Sovettik Sotsialisttik Respublikasynyn

Mamlekettik Gimni"

(State Anthem of

Kirghiz S.S.R.)

(1946-18 Dec 1992) Constitution

(20 Apr 1978;

23 Mar 1937) Population: 2,295,689 (1989)

14 Oct 1924 Kara-Kirghiz Autonomous Oblast (Kara-Kyrgyz avtonomiâluu oblasty/

Kara-Kirgizskaya avtonomnaya oblast') formed, within Russian

S.F.S.R. 25 May 1925 Renamed Kirghiz Autonomous Oblast (Kyrgyz avtonomiâluu oblasty/

Kirgizskaya avtonomnaya oblast'). 7 Mar 1927 Kirghiz Autonomous Socialist Soviet Republic (Kyrgyz Avtonomiâluu

Socialisttik Sovettik Respublikasy/Kirgizskaya Avtonomnaya

Sotsialisticheskaya Sovetskaya Respublika), formed within

the Russian S.F.S.R. 5 Dec 1936 Accession to the Soviet Union (see under Russia).

5 Dec 1936 Becomes Kirghiz Soviet Socialist Republic (Kyrgyz Sovettik

Socialisttik Respublikasy/Kirgizskaya Sovetskaya

Sotsialisticheskaya Respublika).

1 Oct 1989 Kyrgyz is declared state language.

Party abbreviations:KPK = Kırgızstandın Kommunisttik Partiyası/Kommunisticheskaya Partiya Kirgizii (Communist Party of Kyrgyzstan, Marxist-Leninist communist, state party, former KPK-B, 13 Oct 1952-31 Aug 1991);

- Former parties: KPK-B = Kırgızstandın Kommunisttik Partiyası (Syos)/Kommunisticheskaya partiya (Bol'shevikov) Kirgizii (Communist Party [Bolsheviks] of Kyrgyzstan, Marxist-Leninist communist, state party, 23 Apr 1937-13 Oct 1952, renamed KPK); RKP = Rossiyskaya Kommunisticheskaya Partiya (Bol'shevikov)(Russian Communist Party [Bolsheviks], Marxist-Leninist communist, state party, former RSDRP-B, 8 Mar 1918-31 Dec 1925, renamed VKP);VKP = Vsesoyuznaya Kommunisticheskaya Partiya (Bol'shevikov)(All-Union Communist Party [Bolsheviks], Marxist-Leninist communist, state party, former RKP, 31 Dec 1925-13 Oct 1952, renamed Communist Party of the Soviet Union)
